verbs.description: unbrick (third-person singular simple present unbricks, present participle unbricking, simple past and past participle unbricked)

examples: The skylight, although it had been bricked up by someone’s hysterical order, at that time in the past when a man had penetrated the attic-floor of the club to visit a girl, was not beyond being unbricked by the firemen. It was all a question of time.

entries.meaning: (transitive, slang, computing) To repair a device that was bricked (rendered inoperative).
examples: Using JTAG to Unbrick Your Router
